Speaker: mother
Dialogue: Cat! Is your homework finished yet?

Speaker: mother
Dialogue: You draw beautifully my love, but if you want to be something in life you have to study.

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: I am studying Mama. I want to be a super hero.

Speaker: mother
Dialogue: Better to be a doctor. A lawyer.

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: Are we going to see Uncle Emilio?

Speaker: mother
Dialogue: I don't know. Just waiting to hear from your father.

Speaker: don luis
Dialogue: Because I love you Fabio. Like a brother.

Speaker: fabio
Dialogue: And I love you Don Luis. Like a brother.

Speaker: don luis
Dialogue: Can you believe this guy Marco? We started when we were little...how old were we Fabio?

Speaker: don luis
Dialogue: Ten year old bastards stealing apples from the carts in the market. After all we've been through. And now we're on top, he wants to leave...

Speaker: fabio
Dialogue: Luis, I'm going to be honest with you. You remember I had that operation?

Speaker: fabio
Dialogue: Since then, I'm not a hundred percent. And you can't do this thing if you're not a hundred percent. I'm tired.

Speaker: fabio
Dialogue: You know how many times we should have been dead?

Speaker: don luis
Dialogue: I don't even want to count.

Speaker: fabio
Dialogue: Neither do I. But you gotta think. How lucky we are to still be alive.

Speaker: don luis
Dialogue: Yeah. That's right. We're alive. And what about the future of this thing we built?

Speaker: fabio
Dialogue: It's yours. It's not my thing any more.

Speaker: don luis
Dialogue: I'm not going to talk you out of it, am I cabron?

Speaker: fabio
Dialogue: I'll always be there for you Luis. Just pick up the phone, I'm there.

Speaker: don luis
Dialogue: I'm gonna hold you to that. You bastard.  I'm going to miss you.

Speaker: fabio
Dialogue: And I'm going to miss you.

Speaker: don luis
Dialogue: OK. Enough of this sentimental bullshit. Next we'll be crying like two old women. Come on! One last drink, huh?

Speaker: fabio
Dialogue: Adios Marco. Make sure he doesn't get in too much trouble.

Speaker: marco
Dialogue: Adios Don Fabio. I'll do my best.

Speaker: fabio
Dialogue: This bastard thinks I'm an idiot. Playing it all mellow and shit. If he would have yelled and screamed and threatened to kill my whole family, it would have been OK. We have an hour to get out of here. At most.

Speaker: fabio
Dialogue: Listen to me my darling. Just in case of anything. This...

Speaker: fabio
Dialogue: This is your passport. Do you understand?

Speaker: fabio
Dialogue: You find yourself alone? You go to the address on this card. Show it to the man at the front gate.

Speaker: fabio
Dialogue: You don't have to understand. You just have to listen, and remember.

Speaker: man
Dialogue: Hola. We want to see Don Fabio.

Speaker: fabio
Dialogue: And this will keep you safe.

Speaker: fabio
Dialogue: The Cataleya orchid. It comes from one place on Earth. Our place. My mother, your grandmother, used to grow them. Every morning I would wake up to the sight of them. The smell of them. That's why I named you after them. It reminds us of who we are.

Speaker: man
Dialogue: They said he's not home yet.

Speaker: marco
Dialogue: You in the kitchen. You, the bedroom. You, the back.

Speaker: marco
Dialogue: What do you mean so what? You take a kid, teach them, they have value.

Speaker: gunman
Dialogue: I couldn't even get ten bucks for her in the street.

Speaker: marco
Dialogue: Are you stupid or what? Here.

Speaker: marco
Dialogue: Here's twenty asshole. Go do your job.

Speaker: marco
Dialogue: I was at your confirmation. My name is Marco, and I was a very good friend of your father. I see he gave you his medal.

Speaker: marco
Dialogue: The Cataleya orchid. His symbol. Your name. That's good. This way you will always remember him.  I know this is a terrible thing for you to have seen.

Speaker: marco
Dialogue: Some things are too complicated for a kid to understand. This is one of them. But I am going to try explain it and make it very simple for you. So you understand. Now, you know who Don Luis is?

Speaker: marco
Dialogue: Of course you do. He was your father's best friend since they're kids. He's like an Uncle to you. You know he has always been good to your family, don't you?

Speaker: marco
Dialogue: This house, the food you eat, the clothes you wear. Even your school fees. All this comes from Don Luis. You know that?

Speaker: marco
Dialogue: But when someone is good to you and you are not good to them back, then bad things happen. Things like...

Speaker: marco
Dialogue: I know you are a smart girl. You do well in school. So I know this is not too complicated for you to understand. Am I right?

Speaker: marco
Dialogue: Good. Now, your father had something that belonged to Don Luis. A little thing. No bigger than...

Speaker: marco
Dialogue: This. Maybe it was in this.

Speaker: marco
Dialogue: Do you know what I am talking about?

Speaker: marco
Dialogue: Excellent. Do you know where it is?

Speaker: marco
Dialogue: Well, if you give it to me, Don Luis will be very grateful. And very generous. He will make sure that you are clothed, fed, and sent to the very best school. You will have everything you want.

Speaker: marco
Dialogue: So why don't you just give that little thing which belongs to him. Will you do that?

Speaker: marco
Dialogue: And in this life, smart girls get everything they want. What do you want Cat?

Speaker: marco
Dialogue: Just tell me sweetheart...what do you want?

Speaker: marco
Dialogue: North! Go North! We're cutting off the southern streets!

Speaker: marco
Dialogue: We got her! Close the net!

Speaker: american 1
Dialogue: And you say you have something for us?

Speaker: american 1
Dialogue: Did he tell you what this is?

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: We are making our final approach to Miami International airport. Please fasten your seat belts.

Speaker: bureaucrat
Dialogue: You must have done something pretty important to get the royal treatment little lady.

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: It's been our mission statement since we first opened our doors in nineteen twenty three...

Speaker: headmisstress
Dialogue: To provide a safe, healthy nurturing environment where young women can get the education they will need to meet the challenges of that amazing adventure called life. How does that sound to you, my dear?

Speaker: man
Dialogue: It's been a long day for her. Here's the check for the year's tuition.

Speaker: man
Dialogue: And the five hundred dollars allowance for the first six months.

Speaker: headmisstress
Dialogue: And give you twenty a week for incidentals.

Speaker: monitor
Dialogue: Girls, this is your new classmate. Please welcome her and show her the ropes.  Wake up is at seven. Sweet dreams.

Speaker: sherri
Dialogue: Well, 'very tired', I'm sure you want to lay down and rest your little head?

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: But it's gonna cost you.  Twenty dollars.

Speaker: sherri
Dialogue: A week. Peace has it's price, y'know what I'm saying?

Speaker: sherri
Dialogue: You can go now.  In peace.

Speaker: ticket agent
Dialogue: Hola chica, where are we wanting to go today?

Speaker: ticket agent
Dialogue: Chicago is not next door, you know.

Speaker: man
Dialogue: Hey kid. You know what time it is?

Speaker: man
Dialogue: It's late, and this is not the kind of place a kid should be hanging out. What are you doing here?

Speaker: man
Dialogue: There's a girl looking for you.

Speaker: emilio
Dialogue: I'm not interested in a girl right now.

Speaker: man
Dialogue: It's not that sort of thing. She's eight.

Speaker: emilio
Dialogue: Madonna! I thought you were dead!

Speaker: mama
Dialogue: Buenos diaz Cara. Come. Sit. I'll make you some eggs.

Speaker: mama
Dialogue: You have your mother's beautiful eyes. Don't be scared. This is your home.

Speaker: emilio
Dialogue: When was the last time you slept?

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: I don't know. A long time ago.

Speaker: emilio
Dialogue: Well good. A growing body needs sleep. When I was your age I would sleep half the day. I don't know if it helped with the growing, but I was well rested for whatever came after.

Speaker: emilio
Dialogue: No one who is still alive.

Speaker: emilio
Dialogue: You are very talented. Is this what you want to be? An artist?

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: I used to want to be like Lara. A super agent.

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: I want to be a killer.

Speaker: emilio
Dialogue: The good news is your father bought you your life with what he gave you. The bad news is Don Luis was playing both sides, and has disappeared. You tore down everything he spent years building up with that little chip. It is something he will not forget. There is a law in this thing of ours. If someone does you, the revenge goes all the way down the line. Women, children, Grandmothers, dogs, cats. No exceptions.

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: Are you trying to scare me?

Speaker: emilio
Dialogue: I am trying to educate you.

Speaker: principal
Dialogue: Normally we don't accept students in the middle of the academic year, but under the circumstances, losing her parents in that tragic car accident...

Speaker: principal
Dialogue: These are the school supplies you'll need.

Speaker: emilio
Dialogue: She's still in a bit of shock.

Speaker: principal
Dialogue: Of course. See you Monday Cataleya. Such a pretty name.

Speaker: emilio
Dialogue: We'll get all this stuff, then go over to this little place I know down on Maxwell street for some of these hot dogs the Polish people make here.

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: I've already been to school. I told you what I want to be. You don't want to help me, fine. I'll do it myself.

Speaker: emilio
Dialogue: Chica. Any idiot can be a killer. Look!

Speaker: emilio
Dialogue: You want me to teach you to be a killer? No problema. I'll teach you. But you'll be dead in five years.

Speaker: emilio
Dialogue: Now what's it going to be?

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: But I still want to be a killer.

Speaker: cop 1
Dialogue: So then I suggest, y'know, we buy some things to spice it up a bit.

Speaker: cop 1
Dialogue: A garter belt, some of those stockings that come up the thigh...it's fourteen years. Know what I mean?

Speaker: cop 2
Dialogue: Yeah. No matter how much you like steak, sometime a lamb chop is not a bad thing.

Speaker: cop 1
Dialogue: That's all you have to say? Oops?

Speaker: cop 1
Dialogue: Wanna laugh you crazy bitch? I'll give you something to laugh about!

Speaker: sergeant
Dialogue: No license, no registration. No ID except a library card. Well Ms...

Speaker: sergeant
Dialogue: Valarie Phillips in addition to all that...you're being charged here with DUI, destruction of police property, driving the wrong way on a two way street...

Speaker: sergeant
Dialogue: Unless you can think of anything else you should be charged with.

Speaker: sergeant
Dialogue: Take her in the back, lock her up, put a cup of coffee in with her. Let her sleep it off, we'll book her tomorrow.

Speaker: marshal
Dialogue: US Marshal Warren. We have Gennaro Rizzo here on an overnight.

Speaker: marshal
Dialogue: Rizzo. The Mafia guy? On the way to testify up in San Francisco tomorrow? They didn't notify you?

Speaker: sergeant
Dialogue: Here we go. Says here you're not expected until tomorrow.

Speaker: marshal
Dialogue: Never expect the expected Sergeant.  Secure this place.

Speaker: marshal
Dialogue: One man here. Two more outside the front door. Everyone else on the perimeter, in teams of two.

Speaker: marshal
Dialogue: It's a caffeine kinda night fellas. Eyes open.

Speaker: sergeant
Dialogue: Go take a look at the breaker on the ventilation system, will ya?

Speaker: sergeant
Dialogue: Tell it to the judge at your hearing in ten days.

Speaker: sergeant
Dialogue: Nothing. Fill out the forms and you can go.

Speaker: sergeant
Dialogue: Really. We need to get things organized. But don't worry, the judge will send you back, for sure.

Speaker: ross
Dialogue: Same handwriting. Same flower. It's him. Let's see the location.

Speaker: sergeant
Dialogue: You're lucky no one was hurt.

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: I would have never forgiven myself.

Speaker: reporters
Dialogue: Is it Rizzo? Was it an assassination? Are there any clues? Is it true a Marshal did it?

Speaker: marshal
Dialogue: It was after the fact. I didn't think...

Speaker: ross
Dialogue: Do it. Now. No one in or out.

Speaker: marshal
Dialogue: OK! That's it. No one in or out! Lock down!

Speaker: ross
Dialogue: I want to see paper on everyone in and out of the station in the last twenty four hours.

Speaker: ross
Dialogue: And I want the tapes from the security cameras.

Speaker: emilio
Dialogue: Can't wait to see you Cara.

Speaker: ross
Dialogue: He tilted the camera just enough so the angle would catch the guard, not who was holding him.

Speaker: ross
Dialogue: Twenty two murders in four years all with the same M.O. The word, the flower. He's sending a message, for sure. And I'm beginning to think it's not to us.

Speaker: agent 1
Dialogue: But we're the only ones with the information.

Speaker: ross
Dialogue: And we're not getting anywhere with it, are we?

Speaker: ross
Dialogue: If the message is not for us, let's make sure the one it's intended for gets it. I want you to put it out to the press. Splash it across every newspaper, every magazine. National. I want eyeballs on it coast to coast. Monitor it. Let's see if anything comes back.

Speaker: richard
Dialogue: Yes it has Marco. How's the hand?

Speaker: richard
Dialogue: Should've let us relocate you to Arizona instead of New Orleans.

Speaker: richard
Dialogue: I brought you the morning paper.

Speaker: richard
Dialogue: Coincidence? Twenty two times? A flower that only grows in one place on earth? That used to be the calling card of...what was his name? Your former partner? The one who did your wet work?

Speaker: don luis
Dialogue: Fabio. Fabio Maria Restrepo. But I don't understand? Why come here with this?

Speaker: richard
Dialogue: Because when we find the end of a string we like to know where it begins.

Speaker: don luis
Dialogue: String? Now we are talking about string? I'm not a tailor.

Speaker: richard
Dialogue: Don Luis. Let's cut to the chase here, OK? When the Agency extracted your ass from Colombia fifteen years ago, and set you up here, we let you resume your business when what we should have done was lock you up for life. In exchange, you were supposed to keep the information flowing.

Speaker: richard
Dialogue: Not much, and not for a very long time.

Speaker: don luis
Dialogue: And this is what you traveled all the way down here to tell me?

Speaker: richard
Dialogue: No. What I traveled all the way down here to tell you, is there's a limit to our patience. The CIA is not an amusement park. There are no free rides. Everyone pays their way. And you, my friend, have not.

Speaker: don luis
Dialogue: OK OK. What would you want?

Speaker: don luis
Dialogue: I had nothing to do with this. I swear.

Speaker: richard
Dialogue: And Don Luis, don't play the innocent with us. It won't sit well with my bosses if we find out you had anything to do with this. Have a good day.

Speaker: don luis
Dialogue: Idiot! I told you. Everyone dead. Down to the dog.

Speaker: ross
Dialogue: The most recent, was done to keep him from talking. Alexa Milshinova...

Speaker: ross
Dialogue: ...made a career of getting intimate with big stakes gamblers out of Vegas and then taking them off and sending them to meet their maker. D'Angelo James...

Speaker: ross
Dialogue: ...tried to take over the heroin trade in Houston from...

Speaker: ross
Dialogue: The Gemini cartel. Their crimes are self explanatory, if you can read. Now I know some of you are thinking whoever is doing this makes less work for mother. And since there's no collateral damage, why are we wasting valuable manpower and resources on the case? And since until now, there has never been a clue to go on, why go on? But with this last killing...

Speaker: ross
Dialogue: We have one. As we go to the video tape.

Speaker: ross
Dialogue: We can't see the assassin, but we can see...

Speaker: ross
Dialogue: The time. 2 AM. Which means our perp was in the station at...I don't have to spell it out for you.

Speaker: ross
Dialogue: These are the names, phone numbers and addresses of everyone with a pulse who entered that police station before two AM. Cops, criminals, clerks, janitors. Everyone. One of them is our target. I want each of you to locate the ten people in the folder you've been given. I want a complete dossier on every one of them for the last ten years of their lives. Run down every lead. Check out every story. Our killer is out there. And we're going to find him. Before he kills again.

Speaker: danny
Dialogue: You show up whenever you want to...

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: And then we have the most incredible sex.  Ever.

Speaker: danny
Dialogue: Wouldn't you like to go to dinner sometime?

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: No. They put me to sleep.

Speaker: danny
Dialogue: So let's pop in a DVD and you can spend the night here?

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: Would you like the key back?

Speaker: danny
Dialogue: No. I just want to get...I don't know...

Speaker: emilio
Dialogue: You remember the guy who was in the news for running that Ponzi scheme about a year ago?

Speaker: emilio
Dialogue: He disappeared fifty billion dollars. The money was never recovered. Skipped out and bought himself citizenship on some shit hole of a Caribbean island that calls itself a country with no extradition laws. Lot of very pissed off people lost everything.

Speaker: emilio
Dialogue: How long has this been going on?

Speaker: emilio
Dialogue: The paper says twenty two. All like this. Tell me why.

Speaker: emilio
Dialogue: Since you're a kid, you don't do anything for no reason. Don't play dumb, it insults me.

Speaker: emilio
Dialogue: It's not just you in this. It's me, Mama.

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: Tio. You're removed. You book the work, you collect the fees...

Speaker: emilio
Dialogue: I watch your ass. Each and every job, I vet, I double vet. For every one I book you, I turn down five, ten. I promised to keep you safe. I KEEP YOU SAFE. Cataleya. It's a full time job, no matter what you think. Those pictures...they freaked me out. OK? I didn't realize...

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: I come to you at nine. I say I want to be a killer. What kind of kid makes a career choice like that unless they have something on their mind.  I live for the day that the blood of the son of bitch who did my parents drips in the gutter. Stop playing the innocent with me. You know this. Forever.

Speaker: emilio
Dialogue: Sure. Of course. But the way you're playing it. They even have a name for you. The Tag killer. I would have stopped it a long time ago. Had I known about this.

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: If you do, you would never have let me get involved in the first place.

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: Now let's see what good boys you can be.

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: Hola Pepe. I guess the boys gave me away.

Speaker: pepe
Dialogue: Anyone else? The barking would only have stopped when their screaming began. You spoil them.

Speaker: pepe
Dialogue: If that's what you want to call it.

Speaker: pepe
Dialogue: Did you get the beans I like?

Speaker: pepe
Dialogue: Not the one in the short bottle.

Speaker: pepe
Dialogue: I hate that other one, the chili they use sucks. Did you see your uncle?

Speaker: pepe
Dialogue: We're going to church for Easter.

Speaker: pepe
Dialogue: As always. You should, you know.

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: I should do a lot of things.

Speaker: pepe
Dialogue: You could start with that one. It would make us very happy.

Speaker: pepe
Dialogue: Cataleya. No one knows what happens tomorrow, next year is a long time away. How was your trip?

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: Your ears are better than my eyes.

Speaker: pepe
Dialogue: You work too much. I keep telling that to Emilio. The girl should have a life while she is still young enough to enjoy it. You should take a vacation. Go some place warm. With a nice beach.

Speaker: william
Dialogue: Hey! I pay to see more, not less.

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: Willie you are such a perv.

Speaker: servant
Dialogue: It was in the post box this morning.

Speaker: william
Dialogue: Put a drop of blood in there and they'll be your biggest admirers. All the way down to your stripped clean bones. And speaking of stripped...

Speaker: william
Dialogue: Bring extra security in for the night.

Speaker: william
Dialogue: And make sure we're shut down tight.

Speaker: head security
Dialogue: Yes sir. Have a good night, sir.

Speaker: head security
Dialogue: There are already guys in the garden and guys out back. I want you three upstairs, two on the roof. You three downstairs. Follow me.

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: I want you exactly where you are.

Speaker: william
Dialogue: Whatever they paid you, I'll double it!

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: You know the thing about sharks. You can swim with them all day and they will just ignore you, but put one drop of blood in the water and they become your biggest admirers.

Speaker: william
Dialogue: Please. I'll give you anything you want. Don't kill me!

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: I'm not going to kill you.  They are.

Speaker: ross
Dialogue: FBI special agent Jack Ross. I'm lead agent on a case. A serial killer we call the tag killer.

Speaker: ross
Dialogue: Marks his victims with a flower. From Colombia. A Cataleya orchid.

Speaker: richard
Dialogue: Listen, Agent Ross, we don't give out any type of information over the phone. So what I suggest is you file a formal request with the agency for any information you might want. And I'll be more than happy to get back to you as soon as I can.

Speaker: richard
Dialogue: No more bullshitting me Marco. I've got the FBI on my ass now. I want that problem taken care of. Yesterday. Do you hear me?

Speaker: agent 1
Dialogue: We ID'd everyone who came in and out of the police station for the twenty four hours preceding the incident. The only one that we could not verify was a...

Speaker: agent 1
Dialogue: Valarie Phillips. Picked up for drunk driving four hours before the hit on Rizzo.

Speaker: agent 2
Dialogue: Well, there was a little problem. Seems she was too drunk to get a photo.

Speaker: agent 1
Dialogue: We ran the prints in the data base. No match was found.

Speaker: ross
Dialogue: Lovely. So if there is no booking record, how did we get the name?

Speaker: agent 1
Dialogue: A library card. The only ID she had was a library card.

Speaker: ross
Dialogue: It's not a lot to go on. But put them in the data base and let's see what matches.

Speaker: eduardo
Dialogue: I have fifty bucks on this shot. That's what's que pasa.

Speaker: marco
Dialogue: First for fucking up your shot. Second, for an address. You remember Fabio? The Cataleya Killer?

Speaker: eduardo
Dialogue: It's a long time. My memory...

Speaker: marco
Dialogue: You went to school with his brother in law. What was his name? Emilio?

Speaker: marco
Dialogue: I have a problem. And we think Fabio's kid is behind it.

Speaker: eduardo
Dialogue: Look Marco. I gotta be honest with you. Everyone knows you guys were playing a double game, and when the shit went down, you were the only ones who got out of it clean.

Speaker: marco
Dialogue: So you do have a memory.

Speaker: eduardo
Dialogue: Yeah. For rats. Now get the fuck out, and let me take my shot.

Speaker: marco
Dialogue: You don't tell me what I want to know by the count of three, you scum sucking lowlife prick, your memory will be permanently disabled. One...two...

Speaker: danny
Dialogue: Wow! Just what I always wanted.

Speaker: danny
Dialogue: No. No. I mean, a gift from you. Something to show me you're thinking of me as more than your boy toy.

Speaker: danny
Dialogue: Of course I do. But can't we talk a little first?

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: What would you like to talk about?

Speaker: danny
Dialogue: Oh, I don't know. Nothing. Anything.

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: You really want to do this?

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: Nothing much. A little swimming, fed the fish.

Speaker: danny
Dialogue: OK. OK. I get it. You want to protect yourself. I understand. But I'm...I don't just want to be here for the sex. I know a lot of guys would think this is perfect. She comes over, we fuck like mad. She leaves. But I need a little more.

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: That's a hard one for me.

Speaker: danny
Dialogue: I got that. I'm not in a hurry. And just so you know. The past? If it's too painful right now?

Speaker: danny
Dialogue: I didn't know if you like your eggs over easy or scrambled, so I made...

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: Now you know something else about me.

Speaker: emilio
Dialogue: You said you would stop the writing!

Speaker: emilio
Dialogue: Seven people slaughtered in a Miami bar. I knew one of them. Years ago, in school.

Speaker: emilio
Dialogue: I don't like it. This is getting too close.

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: Tio. Could be anyone. You're seeing things that aren't there.

Speaker: emilio
Dialogue: And you are so blinded by your need for revenge that you are not seeing things that are. The handwriting is on the wall Cara. Let me read it to you. This is over. I will no longer accept jobs. I will no longer solicit jobs. You are retired.

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: How many people did you kill in revenge for your boy's death? How many? And you're going to give me a lecture about revenge?

Speaker: emilio
Dialogue: Cara. It's time to get a life, before you run out of time. Here.

Speaker: emilio
Dialogue: Maybe this will help you understand what I am telling you.

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Five six. Brown eyes, hazel really, dark hair, thick, shiny...

Speaker: danny
Dialogue: Great body, killer smile.  And I think about her all day long.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Seriously. This comes from the heart. OK?  The girl comes over, strips down, rocks your world, gets dressed, asks for nothing. Leaves. The only thing she doesn't do is bring the pizza and beer. You are living my dream. And you want to go and fuck it up with love?

Speaker: danny
Dialogue: I knew you were the perfect guy to talk about this with.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Hey come on. It's me. Since first grade. You and me?

Speaker: danny
Dialogue: Ryan, I'm twenty eight. I met someone who I want to be with. All the time. I have nothing. A stuffed animal.  And a picture.

Speaker: danny
Dialogue: It's not even a whole picture. I took it while she was asleep.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Whoa...total babe-age! When do I meet the future Mrs. Delaney?

Speaker: danny
Dialogue: Haven't you been listening to me? I don't even know how to get in touch with her.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Dude. That is such a no brainer.

Speaker: shari
Dialogue: You know, if you weren't my brother's best friend...

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: You're doing it for love Shari. Not for me. When they walk down the aisle, you can say you were the one made it happen.

Speaker: shari
Dialogue: Up to you Danny. I do it all the time. Photo goes in here. Bangs around the National Data base looking for a match. Bingo. Address, phone number, shoe size, dress size, rap sheet, anything you want to know. It's really no big deal.

Speaker: danny
Dialogue: I just feel like, maybe, I'm invading her privacy or something.

Speaker: shari
Dialogue: Hey guys, I haven't got all day.  Yes or no?

Speaker: ross
Dialogue: I want a trace put on an incoming transmission!

Speaker: mama
Dialogue: Cara. You will come home for lunch.

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: No Mama. One thing at a time.

Speaker: mama
Dialogue: That was such a nice surprise.

Speaker: mama
Dialogue: I think she's going to be OK.

Speaker: tech
Dialogue: We need a common base, so let's try size...

Speaker: danny
Dialogue: Oh my god! I can't believe it! Hello you.

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: I was just sitting here, looking out the window. And I thought...where are you?

Speaker: danny
Dialogue: In my apartment. Looking out the window.

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: So we're seeing the same sky.

Speaker: danny
Dialogue: Yes. I'm so happy to hear your voice.

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: And I'm happy to hear yours.

Speaker: ross
Dialogue: We got her! I want SWAT there! All of them! Now!

Speaker: danny
Dialogue: You know it's so crazy. I was just sitting here, looking at your picture, thinking "I'd wish I could call her." And you called.

Speaker: danny
Dialogue: I'm sorry. I know I shouldn't have. But I have nothing to remember you by, except this little stuffed...

Speaker: danny
Dialogue: I took a picture of you while you were sleeping. With my phone.

Speaker: danny
Dialogue: Jen. I'm sorry. Really. I didn't mean to offend you.

Speaker: danny
Dialogue: ...it's just you looked so cute. I can erase it if you want. It's not even a good picture...Jen?

Speaker: danny
Dialogue: His sister. I didn't want to..it's just...I wanted to contact you. I wanted to...

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: What does the sister of Ryan have to do with this?

Speaker: danny
Dialogue: Shari, that's Ryan's sister...she works at Police headquarters...

Speaker: agent 1
Dialogue: No ma'am everything is under control. We just need you to stay inside. May we have a look around?

Speaker: ross
Dialogue: She's not here. Lock the building down!

Speaker: ross
Dialogue: Where the hell did she go?

Speaker: ross
Dialogue: No one in or out! Lock this place down! Anyone?

Speaker: ross
Dialogue: All units! Converge on the garage. Cover every exit!

Speaker: ross
Dialogue: Look under every car. In every trunk!!!

Speaker: operator
Dialogue: Federal Bureau of Investigation. How may I direct your call?

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: I'd like to speak to the agent in charge of the TAG killings.

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: This won't take long. Hands up.

Speaker: ross
Dialogue: Just so you know, all this? Being so smart? Covering all your bases? It's not going to matter. It's already over. The whole place is wired with web cams.

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: Talking about covering all your bases. Your chair is pressure wired. You move your ass one inch you don't have one anymore.

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: I know what you're thinking. Maybe yes a bluff, maybe no. But you have to figure yes, given what you know about me.

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: This wasn't what I had in mind for myself when I was a kid. I wanted to be on the other side of things. Like you.

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: This is the last time I was happy.

Speaker: ross
Dialogue: And all this? All these clues...they weren't for us. They were for him.

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: I didn't know how else to find him.

Speaker: ross
Dialogue: And you figured sooner or later we would make this public.

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: It took you a long time.

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: What else do I have to be? I have no one. I did. Until this morning. I had them.

Speaker: ross
Dialogue: You sent him a message. He sent you one back.

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: And now I want to finish it.

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: Yes you can. He's protected by your government.

Speaker: ross
Dialogue: By a part of the government I have no way of reaching. It's CIA. I don't know why. But there's no getting through it, under it, around it, believe me, I've tried.

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: You're going to have to try harder.

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: I found this on your table inside. Your family, right?

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: Brothers, sisters, nieces, nephews. Mother, father. Nice.

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: I know this sounds harsh. But until I get what I want, you'll go to a funeral a week. And you will begin to feel what I have felt all these years.

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: When your dinner's ready, the timer on it will have expired. Then you can get to work.

Speaker: richard
Dialogue: You understand, I only agreed to this meeting out of professional courtesy.

Speaker: ross
Dialogue: Look, let's put all our cards on the table here. I've met this woman. The killer.

Speaker: ross
Dialogue: My apartment. She trapped me. She told me if I did not get her this man.

Speaker: ross
Dialogue: She will kill a member of my family every day until I have none.

Speaker: ross
Dialogue: Do I look like I could make something like that up?

Speaker: ross
Dialogue: So? What should I do now?

Speaker: richard
Dialogue: I'd go to the police. Now if you'll excuse me, I have a meeting...

Speaker: richard
Dialogue: What does she think this is? Amateur hour? Tell her that glass is tempered to resist a direct hit by a fifty seven millimeter ordinance.

Speaker: ross
Dialogue: She says she's using seven point six two steel jacketed armor piercing shells. And you have ten seconds to give her the address.

Speaker: richard
Dialogue: How can I be sure once she has the address she won't kill me anyway?

Speaker: ross
Dialogue: You can't. But I can assure you that if you don't give her the address you will be number twenty four on her hit parade. Trust me on this one.

Speaker: richard
Dialogue: Eight seven six Magnolia Terrace... New Orleans.

Speaker: ross
Dialogue: She asked you to keep this conversation strictly confidential.

Speaker: ross
Dialogue: Thank you. Because honestly I didn't know how I was going to explain you splattered all over your walls.

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: You guys ever been to New Orleans?

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: I didn't know if you took sugar and cream, so I got one of each.

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: You designed the house at eight seven six Magnolia.

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: You either leave immediately young lady or I am going to call the police.

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: I would love to see the plans of this house.

Speaker: marco
Dialogue: You will take up positions here...

Speaker: marco
Dialogue: And here. And here. You must expect the unexpected. She is like mist under a door, like a mouse in the wall. She will never attack straight on. You will not see her, until it is too late. She is that invisible.

Speaker: marco
Dialogue: We would prefer she be taken alive. But with a bitch like this, if you get a kill shot you take it.

Speaker: marco
Dialogue: You four! Get the armored Mercedes! We have to get Don Luis out of here!

Speaker: marco
Dialogue: Don Luis! This way! Everyone to their positions!

Speaker: marco
Dialogue: Wait for my call. Either she is dead, or we have her far enough away so you can make it to the garage. Take the van. The armor is so thick nothing short of an atomic bomb can penetrate it.

Speaker: marco
Dialogue: That's the first time you ever said that.

Speaker: marco
Dialogue: You know what bitch? I loved killing your father. He was a coward! And you know what else? I screwed your mother behind your father's back! We all did! She couldn't get enough of it! The whore! I killed her! I killed him! You want to avenge them? The whore and the coward? That's what you come from! Come out! I'm here! Come get the bullet with your name on it, Bitch!

Speaker: marco
Dialogue: You two here! That door opens...

Speaker: don luis
Dialogue: Marco! What the hell's going on???

Speaker: marco
Dialogue: I will hold here! Run! Run!

Speaker: marco
Dialogue: Do it! Do it you bitch! Isn't this the moment you've been waiting for?

Speaker: don luis
Dialogue: I beat you bitch! You can't kill me! I am unkillable!

Speaker: don luis
Dialogue: I don't understand you. You should have been dead a long time ago. You got lucky. You escaped. You were given a second chance at a life. Why did you not take it? Why did you involve yourself with this insanity?

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: For something you can never understand. The love I had for my parents. And you killed that.

Speaker: don luis
Dialogue: And because of that, you have ruined your whole life to try to kill me? You stupid bitch. Don't you get it? Someone like me?

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: Actually Don Luis...you are exactly where I want you to be.

Speaker: danny
Dialogue: I already told you everything. She would come over, we'd have amazing sex, and she would leave. It's really late, and I'm really tired, if you're not going to arrest me...

Speaker: ross
Dialogue: We don't really have anything to charge you with.

Speaker: danny
Dialogue: Can I have a cup of coffee?

Speaker: danny
Dialogue: Jen...I...uh...I'm so sorry. I didn't mean...are you OK?

Speaker: danny
Dialogue: FBI headquarters. I didn't tell them anything...besides...

Speaker: danny
Dialogue: Will I ever see you again?

Speaker: cat
Dialogue: I know where to find you.

Speaker: agent 1
Dialogue: Ross. We're picking something up off that kid's phone.

Speaker: danny
Dialogue: If there is ever a chance. I want you to know...I could love you. If you let me.
